name: Flower of Bristol
climate: The Flower of Bristol thrives in a temperate climate, enjoying mild conditions.
It prefers regions where temperatures remain steady without extreme highs or lows.
This plant does well in areas with seasonal variations but no harsh winters.
It can adapt to a range of environments but favors environments with consistent humidity.
sunlight: This plant requires full sunlight to partial shade to grow optimally.
Direct sunlight for a good part of the day helps it bloom best.
Though tolerant, insufficient sunlight can result in poor flowering.
In tropical climates, it can adapt to dappled light beneath tree canopies.
watering: Regular watering is essential, especially during its active growth phase.
The Flower of Bristol must not be left in waterlogged soil to prevent root rot.
It benefits from consistent moisture and should not completely dry out between waterings.
In extremely hot weather, more frequent watering may be necessary to maintain health.
soil: Well-draining soil is crucial for the healthy growth of Flower of Bristol.
It thrives best in organically rich soils with good air circulation around roots.
Soil should retain some moisture while also allowing excess water to escape.
Loamy or sandy soils enriched with compost improve its overall growth and bloom.
toxic: While generally safe, ingestion of the plant parts by pets may lead to mild irritation.
extra_care_tip: Pruning is beneficial after flowering to maintain a compact shape and health.
Deadheading spent blooms can enhance the plant's appearance and flowering efficiency.
